alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 2:56AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A storm system spinning over the San Francisco Bay Area is bringing persistent moderate to heavy rain that will continue for the next few hours. This rain has caused rises in local creeks including Alameda Creek near Sunol. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Alameda county above the Diversion Dam near Sunol and northeast of Calaveras Reservoir. * WHEN...Until 600 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 AM PST, River gauge in this area reported a gauge height of 6.81 ft which is in minor flood stage (above 6 ft). Minor flooding is occurring in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has already fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Alameda County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
